title.narrative: Inclusion and protection-based humanitarian and recovery assistance for older women and men, including older people with disabilities, affected by the ongoing conflict in Eastern Ukraine.

description.narrative: Objective 1, Protection: 3,652 older people, 60yrs+ (70% women and 30% men). Objective 2, MPCA: 200 vulnerable older people, 60yrs+ (70% women and 30% men) and their household members (400)

Older women and men, including older people with disabilities, affected by the ongoing conflict in Eastern Ukraine access inclusive, protection-based humanitarian support at individual household level and community level that contributes to their improved security, dignity and wellbeing.

Target Area: Donetsk Oblast (GCA), 12 Settlements: - Volnovaskyi rayon: Hranitne, Lebedynske, Novotroitske, Pavlopil, Sopyne. - Marinskyi rayon: Berezove, Krasnohorivka, Marinka, Novomykhailivka, Slavne, Stepne, Taramchuk.

This projects aims to support older men and women and older people with disabilities affected by the humanitarian crisis in Eastern Ukraine have improved security, dignity, wellbeing and ability to cope with the impacts of the humanitarian crisis. It builds on ongoing projects to provide direct Psychosocial Support (PSS) to older women and men affected by the conflict through a case management approach of Homebased Care (HBC), Community Safe Space (CSS) center activities, provision of individualized protection assistance, such as assistive products, hygiene items, adult diapers/incontinence pads as well as unrestricted, unconditional multipurpose cash assistance during the harsh winter period. This integrated protection intervention will ensure that older women and men who face mobility restrictions or are isolated or are adopting negative coping mechanisms, have improved access to humanitarian aid and social services, are re-integrated into their communities and improve their psychosocial wellbeing and resilience.
Additionally, HelpAge International will provide practical technical capacity building, mentoring/coaching of selected local and international organisations and government departments, in age and disability inclusive programming, especially related to the ‘Humanitarian Inclusion Standards on Older People and People with Disabilities' and inclusive case management and HBC standards adopted to the Ukrainian context. Given the existing vulnerabilities and protection concerns faced by older women and men, including those with disabilities, HelpAge will complement direct protection assistance with advocacy at local and national level, including close cooperation with local authorities and select ministries, to ensure that older people's concerns and vulnerability are addressed.
Vulnerable older people in the affected areas have improved access to basic essential goods and services through multipurpose cash assistance (MPCA).
